706642f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, north side, at Hoyt Street; Frederick Loeser's
garage on the N.W. corner.
May 29, 1929.
P.. L. Sperr.

706640f-a.text:
(1)
Schermerhorn Street, north side, west frem Hoyt Street, across excavation for the Eighth Ave., Subway of the N.Y. City Independent
Lines.
October 5, 1929.

(2)
The same, from a different angle.
October 5, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)  The same, about twe years later, showing the excavation filled
in.
April 1S, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

706643f-b.text:
211 to 225 (left to right) Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Hoyt and Bond Streets, showing a group of old
houses in Brooklyn's business district.
View 2 is looking eastward and shows also the Frederick LLoeser Department tore. Numbers 217-219 were rased.
View 1: May 29, 1929
View 2: April 7, 1932
P. L. Sperr
706643f-b.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Hoyt Street, Brooklyn, NY

705001f-c.text:
(1)
Hoyt Street, east side, from Schermerhorn to State Streets, Also seen is 311-313 1d State Street, at the N.E. cerner of Hoyt Street.
May 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the house which was built about 1874 by the Clark
family whose estate comprise surrounding area.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, from a different angle.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
